# Code Generation Instructions
- Generate code based on SOLID principles (Single Responsibility, Open/Closed, Liskov Substitution, Interface Segregation, Dependency Inversion).
- Keep functions small and focused.
- Keep code DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself).
- Keep code KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid).
- Keep code YAGNI (You Aren't Gonna Need It).
- Keep lines of code in one file under 500 lines.
- Avoid hardcoding values; use variables or environment variables.
- Don't leave commented-out code.
- Use descriptive variable names.
